The blind-spot monitor is a vehicle-based sensor device that detects other vehicles located to the driverâ€™s side and rear. Warnings can be visual, audible, vibrating, or tactile. However, blind-spot monitors are an option that may do more than monitor the sides and rear of the vehicle. They may also include Cross Traffic Alert, which alerts drivers backing out of a parking space when traffic is approaching from the sides. This feature can be sen in luxurious cars like Audi, BMW and recently the Korean company Kia configured this feature in its latest offering Seltos.
